current.name: Emma Johnson
current.achievements: Personal best in 50m freestyle, 100m butterfly, and 200m IM
current.quote: I love swimming because it makes me feel strong and free!
current.coach_comment: Emma has shown incredible dedication this season. Her technique improvements in butterfly have been remarkable.

previous.name: Michael Chen
previous.achievements: Qualified for State Championships in 100m breaststroke
previous.quote: Swimming has taught me that hard work and consistency pay off.
previous.coach_comment: Michael's work ethic is outstanding. He's always the first one in and the last one out of practice.

previous.name: Sophia Rodriguez
previous.achievements: First competitive meet with no disqualifications in all four strokes
previous.quote: I was nervous but my teammates helped me feel brave!
previous.coach_comment: Sophia has overcome her fear of diving and is now one of our most enthusiastic swimmers.

technique.title: Technique & Training Videos
technique.description: Proper technique is essential for swimming efficiency and speed. Watch these instructional videos to improve your strokes.

videos.title: Freestyle Technique Fundamentals
videos.description: Learn the key elements of an efficient freestyle stroke, including body position, arm pull, kick, and breathing.
coach_tips: Focus on a steady six-beat kick
Keep your head still - look at the bottom of the pool
Roll your body along the long axis

videos.title: Backstroke Technique Breakdown
videos.description: Master the backstroke with proper body position, arm movement, and kick technique.
coach_tips: Keep your head still with ears in the water
Maintain a steady kick from the hips
Enter the water with your pinky finger first

videos.title: Breaststroke: Timing is Everything
videos.description: Learn the proper timing of the pull, kick, and glide phases of breaststroke.
coach_tips: Don't lift your head too high

videos.title: Butterfly Made Simple
videos.description: Break down the butterfly stroke into manageable components to build a strong, efficient technique.
coach_tips: Drive your chest forward and down
Kick twice for every arm cycle
Keep your recovery low and relaxed

dryland.title: Dryland Training Program
dryland.description: Strengthen your swimming performance with these out-of-pool exercises designed specifically for swimmers.
dryland.introduction: Dryland training is an essential component of swim training that helps build strength, power, and flexibility. These exercises complement your in-water training and can help prevent injuries.

workouts.title: Core Strength Routine
workouts.description: A strong core is essential for maintaining proper body position in the water.

exercises.name: Russian Twists
exercises.description: Seated with knees bent, twist torso side to side

exercises.name: Superman
exercises.description: Lie face down, lift arms and legs simultaneously

exercises.name: Flutter Kicks
exercises.description: Lie on back, legs extended, alternate small kicks

workouts.title: Upper Body Strength
workouts.description: Build pulling power for stronger strokes.

exercises.name: Resistance Band Pulls
exercises.description: Mimic swimming pull pattern with resistance band

exercises.name: Shoulder External Rotation
exercises.description: With resistance band for rotator cuff strength

workouts.title: Flexibility Routine
workouts.description: Improve range of motion for more efficient strokes.

exercises.name: Ankle Flexibility
exercises.description: Pointed toe and flexed foot positions

exercises.name: Hip Flexor Stretch
exercises.description: Lunge position with back knee on ground

exercises.name: Butterfly Stretch
exercises.description: Seated with soles of feet together

strategy.title: Event Strategy & Time Goals
strategy.description: Learn race strategies and set personal time goals for your events.

events.title: 50m Freestyle Strategy
events.description: The 50m freestyle is all about explosive power and maintaining maximum speed from start to finish.

strategy: Focus on a strong start with a good streamline
Breathe only 1-2 times during the race
Finish strong with a big kick
Powerful start with a tight streamline
Limit breathing to once every 4-6 strokes
High elbow recovery with powerful pull
Strong finish without breathing last 5 meters

events.title: 100m Freestyle Strategy
events.description: The 100m freestyle requires a balance of speed and endurance with strategic pacing.

strategy: Strong start but don't sprint all-out
Increase turnover and kick for final 25m

timeTracker.title: Personal Best Time Tracker
timeTracker.description: Use this tracker to record your times and see your improvement throughout the season.
instructions: Record the date, meet name, and your time for each event
Note any specific feedback from coaches
Set a goal time for your next meet

bestTimes.title: Personal Best Times Tracker
bestTimes.description: Track your swimming progress by recording your personal best times and setting goals for improvement.
bestTimes.introduction: Recording your personal best times helps you track your progress and set realistic goals. Use this tracker to celebrate your achievements and visualize your improvement over time.
tips: Focus on technique improvements, not just time
Celebrate every achievement, no matter how small
Track your progress over time to stay motivated
Work with your coach to identify areas for improvement
